text: Ariston Records was a record label established in Milan, Italy, by Alfredo Rossi (1925-2008). It was active from 1964 to 1989. It was part of the larger Ariston Group, which was founded in 1949 by Alfredo and his brother, the composer Carlo Alberto Rossi (1921-2010), and which included several publishing firms, recording studios, and a record pressing plant. Musicians who recorded for the label included I Corvi, Bruno Lauzi, Ornella Vanoni, Mino Reitano, Franco Califano, Claudio Rocchi, and Donatella Rettore.
